title: What's your biggest relationship turn-off? - Quora

response.answer_text: It really comes down to one thing for me—not feeling a connection with my partner. I’ve been happily married for the past 21 years, but I remember dating other women before I met my wife. The girls I had been with were pretty and they were nice, but there was just something off between me and them. The things they talked about seemed petty and foolish to me, and they exhibited attitudes and behaviors that I didn’t approve of. And when I shared my thoughts and feelings with them, I felt like I was wasting my breath. They weren’t interested in learning who I really was, and they didn’t seem to care about things like that. It’s funny how our minds work. There seems to be a lot of people who are like me. We don’t really know what we’re doing when we’re dating. We are all just floundering—responding to attraction, and hoping for the best. We tend to hold on to the person that we are seeing. We’re not sure of how we really feel about them, or how they feel about us—and at the same time, we don’t want to hurt them. But even in the midst of all that uncertainty, our instincts are screaming at us. If only we would listen to them. In my case, I instinctively knew that I didn’t want to introduce any of the girls I had been dating to my family. I felt an unease whenever I considered the idea, and even embarassment—like I was ashamed to be with them. This should have been my cue to end those relationships, but I wasn’t listening. I continued on until things ultimately fell apart. But things were completely different when I met the girl who became my wife. I felt a strong connection with her right from the start, and she felt the same with me. I felt sure about her, and I was proud to have her by my side. I felt no reservations when I introduced her to my family, and they all loved her. One of the great things about having a deep and strong bond with the person you are in a relationship with is; that it causes you to overlook the little things that you would normally think are turn offs.
